title: Insight as to why I was permabanned for this?
body:
Got permabanned for this chatlog, and I am thoroughly confused as to why.

Here is the chat log from the game:
Game 3109469809:
Nithez: thanks for giving kayle 2 kills
Nithez: i appreciate it
Nithez: u 2
Nithez: keep camping if shes gonna keep pushing
[All]Nithez: nice
Nithez: double kill you gave kayle at start u feel
Nithez: how
Nithez: i had no mana for baron...
Nithez: i didnt think you needed me im sorry...
Nithez: you guys gave kayle a doulbe kill for fb but im trolling
Nithez: okkkk
Nithez: im sorry xerath please stop calling me a %%%%%%
Nithez: no i havent
Nithez: what i do
[All]Nithez: eve called me a %%%
[All]Nithez: plz report

I didn't help the team with a baron because I thought they could do it without me, and the Xerath on our team started flipping out, typing in all caps about how I was trolling, calling me a fa**ot, etc etc, and all I said back was to please stop calling me that. I then accidentally said to report the Eve on our team to the enemy instead of saying Xerath because she had been typing messages telling him to chill and overall taking my side that he was being super toxic. The support staff I've been talking to has said I'm getting perma banned for using homophobic slurs and falsely reporting, yet no where in this chat log do I call anyone a homophobic slur, I simply ask the dude flaming me to stop, and tell the enemy team what he was calling me so that they could report him (even tho I mistakenly ask them to report the wrong person; shouldn't be a big deal seeing as eve wasn't doing anything wrong and won't be punished; this is also the first time I've ever encouraged "falsely reporting" someone). Seems a bit harsh to permaban someone for accidentally saying one champs name instead of the other. Would love some insight on this. Is it because I am a month off a 2 week ban, and this is just to prove a point? I didn't break any guidelines here. Didn't flame anyone, call anyone names, encourage self harm, literally nothing besides asking the enemy to report the wrong person.

replies.body: Because you repeated stupid shit (zero tolerance) and had a previous 14 day ban. You can try to submit a support ticket since that seems to be the worse of it. Assuming no other logs.

I originally thought there was a mistake because it was just that log, with everything I copy and pasted being the entirety. I understand the 0 tolerance... but we are humans, we should use context to look at situations. Not using it towards anyone remotely, just wanted the dude calling me it to stop, and then asking the enemy to report him by letting them know what he was calling me. I'm so mindblown that this is the final nail in the coffin, not me actually being toxic and deserving it.

Submit a request for review and explain that one instance was asking to not call you such; the other simply asking for a report and reason.

Explain you didn't realize using them as such would cause trouble.
Somehow... I have a gut feeling that OP  is one of those that falsely claim someone said bad words and is trying to get others to report the other player and get banned for it.

Nope, no context.

You get trolls in your team that tell you the worst? Don't say anything.

You get trolls who go 0-10 in the first 5 minutes? Don't say anything.

Someone tells you the worst things? Again, don't say anything.

Naturally, you should just report and let them handle it because otherwise it becomes chaos and I do agree with Riot, but, frankly, this has become a joke now.

There's a difference between people that defend themselves, which you need to do every game if you don't take crap from others or being negative and people using slurs and saying extreme stuff. One shows frustration while not going over the edge, the other shows ill-intent. Mute the first, ban the second.

I still can't believe that you can get perma-banned in a game for not being positive.

That numbering of the games is quite strange: "Game 3109469809:"
Granted I could be mistaken. It seems when you get provided logs via a support ticket, that is the number string you get. Reform cards simplify it to Game 1-however many logs.

Asking for reports is/can be considered harassment, since you only need one report to flag a player (x9 is same as x1). Therefore, you only need YOUR report filed, thus asking for more than one report is a form of harassment ("ganging up" on the player). Also using homophobic slurs is usually insta-ban.
People like you who actually read the rules makes me happy :)

Someone has already mentioned that in this thread. They (PS) need to read the ticket and be fully convinced that you wont cause any more trouble. It's not guaranteed they will lift the ban if you do this but that is in my experience when they worked with me. 

There's a few good youtube videos on this subject (lifting permabans), and if you are interested I can show you my logs when PS worked with me to lift the permanent suspension on my account.

I was very fortunate and grateful to have PS  work with me and help me and give me my account back. I know Riots stance on permanent bans is no reversals, but I have first hand seen it undone. _Not guaranteed but worth a shot._

I even explained that I would be fine with another long ban, simply because I did ask for a report on the wrong person, and did type the slur (even though it was not directed at anyone).

To be perfectly honest, even without repeating zero-tolerance phrases, you would probably still have gotten permabanned. After a 14-day suspension, your account is on thin ice, as your reform card states.

Harassing a teammate about their performance:

> Nithez: double kill you gave kayle at start u feel

Joining an argument and continuing to harass about performance:

> Nithez: you guys gave kayle a doulbe kill for fb but im trolling

Arguing, harassing via calling for reports (ignoring the ZT phrase here):

> [All]Nithez: eve called me a %%%
> [All]Nithez: plz report

Of course, it's _possible_ that you might have escaped a punishment for just the above, but even without the ZT phrases, it would likely have been enough. If you find a support rep who tunnel-visions on the ZT phrases and convince them that they were indeed just repetitions that weren't directed at anyone (which I sincerely believe you on, by the way), they might lift the permaban. But if the support reps you get notice the harassment and arguing, your account is probably gone for good.
